text: Ali Khamenei, current supreme leader of Iran as Tehran's Friday Prayer Imam in 1980. The following is a list of Tehran's Friday Prayer Imams that were appointed after the 1979 Iranian Revolution. It contains both permanent and temporary Imams. The current Imam is Supreme Leader of Iran Sayyid Ali Khamenei, who also appoints temporary Imams. Mohammad Emami Kashani, Ahmad Khatami, Kazem Seddiqi, Ali Movahedi-Kermani, Mohammad-Hassan Aboutorabi Fard and Mohammad Javad Haj Ali Akbari are currently Tehran's temporary Imams. == Imams == {| border="1" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 85%;" |- ! N° !! Imam !! Date !! Appointed by !! Notes |- ||1|| Sayyed Abolqasem Emam Jomeh||Unknown – ||Unknown||Dismissed from the position by the Constitutionalists |- ||2|| Mohammad Emamzadeh||1908 – 1947||Unknown||Died in a candle |- ||3|| Hassan Emami|| 1947 – 1979|| Mohammad-Reza Shah||Left office due to Iranian Revolution |} === Post-1979 === {| border="1" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font- size: 85%;" |- ! N° !! Imam !! Date !! Appointed by !! Notes |- ||1|| Mahmoud Taleghani||27 July 1979 – 9 September 1979 || Ruhollah Khomeini||Died in office |- ||2|| Hussein-Ali Montazeri||12 September 1979 – 14 January 1980|| Ruhollah Khomeini||Resigned |- ||3|| Ali Khamenei|| 14 January 1980 – present|| Ruhollah Khomeini ||Nominated by Hussein Ali Montazeri |} ==== Temporary Imams ==== {| border="1" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 85%;" |- ! N° !! Imam !! Date !! Appointed by !! Notes |- ||1|| Abdolkarim Mousavi Ardebili||13 February 1981 – 24 December 1993|| Ruhollah Khomeini||Imamate unofficially anded |- ||2|| Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani||3 July 1981 – 17 July 2009|| Ruhollah Khomeini||Imamate unofficially anded |- ||3|| Mohammed Emami-Kashani||30 October 1981 – present|| Ruhollah Khomeini|| |- ||4||Mohammad Mahdi Rabbani Amlashi||11 December 1981 – ?|| Ruhollah Khomeini||He was Imam 3 times |- ||5|| Mohammad Yazdi||1982 – late 1990s|| Ruhollah Khomeini||Resigned |- ||6|| Mohammad-Reza Mahdavi Kani||11 March 1983 – 19 June 2009|| Ruhollah Khomeini||He was Imam 100 times |- ||7||Ahmad Jannati||18 April 1994 – 11 March 2018|| Ali Khamenei||Resigned |- ||8||Hassan Taheri Khorracgggmabadi||?|| Ali Khamenei He was Imam 8 times |- ||9|| Ahmad Khatami||18 December 2005 – present|| Ali Khamenei|| |- ||10||Kazem Seddiqi||1 August 2009 – present|| Ali Khamenei|| |- ||11||Ali Movahedi-Kermani||2 December 2012 – present|| Ali Khamenei|| |- ||12||Mohammad-Hassan Aboutorabi Fard||14 February 2018 – present|| Ali Khamenei|| |- ||13||Mohammad-Javad Haj Ali Akbari||31 December 2018 – present|| Ali Khamenei|| |} == See also == * Friday prayer in Shi'i Islam * List of Vali-e-Faqih representatives in provinces (of Iran) == References == Imams Category:Iranian imams Friday Prayer Imams Friday Prayer Imams
